definition:
A field $K$ is *algebraically closed* if every non-constant polynomial
in $K[X]$ has a root in $K$.

An extension field $L$ of $K$ is an *algebraic closure* of $K$ if $L$ is
algebraically closed and every element of $L$ is algebraic over $K$.
Using the axiom of choice, one can show that any field has an algebraic
closure. Moreover, any two algebraic closures of a field are isomorphic
as fields, but not necessarily canonically isomorphic.
